alert.note: Alert for Western Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 18 at 4:15AM AKST until November 20 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 50 to 65 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Western Aleutians. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong low will push a front across the western Aleutians, bringing southerly winds and heavy rain. Winds will peak two separate times with the passage of this low. The first peak will occur tonight with the arrival of the front. Winds diminish to gale force on Sunday morning, before a second round of high winds on Sunday evening.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
